derivation: middle voice from a derivative of the same as G3984 (πορεύομαι);
kjv_def: --depart, go (away, forth, one's way, up), (make a, take a) journey, walk
strongs_def: to traverse, i.e. travel (literally or figuratively; especially to remove (figuratively, die), live, etc.);
outline:
1. to lead over, carry over, transfer
    1. to pursue the journey on which one has entered, to continue on one's journey
    2. to depart from life
    3. to follow one, that is: become his adherent
      1. to lead or order one's life
